title: Nikki Teo: Charlie Teo’s daughter fronts court
text:
October 17, 2019. Nicola Teo leaves Windsor court in Sydney's north west over allegedly driving at least 100 metres on the wrong side of the road before crashing into former bikie boss Jock Ross. Teo, daughter of renowned neurosurgeon Charlie Teo, is charged with dangerous driving occasioning grievous bodily harm, negligent driving occasioning grievous bodily harm, not keeping left of the dividing line and not giving particulars to police (AAP VIDEO/Aine Fox)

The daughter of renowned neurosurgeon Charlie Teo has appeared in court accused of dangerous driving that left a former bikie boss fighting for his life.

Nicola Teo is alleged to have been driving on the wrong side of the road with a child in the passenger seat when her Toyota LandCruiser hit former Comanchero hard man Jock Ross head-on.

The incident happened in the Hawkesbury region outside Sydney on the afternoon of September 25.

Wearing a beige jacket, white top and dark trousers, Ms Teo stood to identify herself in court but did not speak during the short hearing at Windsor Local Court on Thursday.

She declined to answer reporters’ questions as she left the court.

Police previously said Ms Teo declined to provide detailed information to officers after the crash on Settlers Rd at Lower Macdonald, near Wisemans Ferry.

She is alleged to have crashed into a 76-year-old male motorcyclist, former Comanchero president William George “Jock” Ross, leaving him fighting for his life.

Ross, a Scottish immigrant, founded the bikie gang in 1968. He was the instigator of the 1984 Milperra Massacre that left seven people dead and 28 injured in a shootout between the Comancheros and the breakaway Bandidos gang.

Ross was handed a life sentence for his role in the violence but he and eight others had their murder convictions quashed and downgraded to manslaughter by the Court of Criminal Appeal. He was released in 1992 after serving a little more than five years of his sentence.

The case has been adjourned until December 12.
description: The daughter of renowned neurosurgeon Charlie Teo has appeared in court accused of dangerous driving that left a former bikie boss fighting for his life.
